title: REMINISCENCE Ending Explained!
author: Think Story
comment:
To think Jackman could have made 10 Kate and Leopold sequels by now!

Check out my other sci-fi breakdowns here: https://youtube.com/playlist?list=PLY9KJ1cFVs7iajBX4Ibg6jaCAH1eIuSgd
I enjoyed this movie, but that might be because Hugh Jackman does a really fucking good job

The movie was beautiful and impressive, and it had some really interesting ideas, however, I feel that the world building elements of this film; the rising waters and the wars everyone talks about, and the struggles people went through past tense, would have been a much better aspect to present instead of this noir/romance rehash of China Town/Inception crossover. Also I don't know how anyone else felt about the dialogue but to me it was weird...like it didn't feel like humans talking, instead it felt like people speaking tediously. Almost poetically. Perhaps because we are viewing things from his memories and therefore everything feels "artificial" but it made it all feel very clunky and it was difficult for me to become invested.
This was one of the best bad written movies like even tho you dont really know whats going on in some parts its still really engaging
I'm really tired of the sexy, female love interest who speaks in eloquent prose that the male interest just falls massively in love with in 3 days.
description:
In this video we take a deep dive, review, recap and explain the ending to HBO Max and Warner Bros.  REMINISCENCE starring Hugh Jackman and Rebecca Ferguson.
